intro: Tibouchina patens, commonly known as the Brazilian violet or purple tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Tibouchina patens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
